pertinence_mapping.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /* University of Genoa - Software Architecture for Robotics (2017/2018) */
2 /* Project: Teleoperation with MIRO - Mateus Sanches Moura, Suman Ghosh */
3 /* Pertinence Mapper service source code */
4 
5 /* Libraries */
6 #include "ros/ros.h"
7 #include "miro_teleop/PertinenceMapping.h"
8 #include <cstdio>
9 #include <cmath>
10 #include <opencv2/core/core.hpp>
11 #include <opencv2/highgui/highgui.hpp>
12 
13 /* Constants */
14 #define HSIZE 300 // Horizontal map size (in cm)
15 #define VSIZE 300 // Vertical map size (in cm)
16 #define NZ 5 // Number of zones
17 #define RES 30 // Grid resolution
18 #define GAMMA 2.0 // Scaling factor for target pertinences
19 
20 /* Service function */
21 bool PertinenceMapper(miro_teleop::PertinenceMapping::Request &req,
22  miro_teleop::PertinenceMapping::Response &res)
23 {
24  /* Input 3-D matrix to be processed (received from master) */
25  std_msgs::Float64 matrices[NZ*RES*RES];
26 
27  /* Landscape matrix to be returned (mapped into an 1-D array) */
28  std_msgs::Float64 landscape[RES*RES];
29 
30  double max = 0;
31 
32  ROS_INFO("Request received from master node");
33  ROS_INFO("Target: (%f %f)",req.target.x,req.target.y);
34 
35  /* Obtain input from request */
36  for(int i=0;i<req.matrices.size();i++)
37  matrices[i].data = req.matrices[i].data;
38 
39  /* Extract target coordinates and map to grid */
40  int Px = floor((req.target.x+HSIZE/2)*RES/HSIZE);
41  // Inverting y coordinate to match matrix ordering
42  int Py = RES-1-floor((req.target.y+VSIZE/2)*RES/VSIZE);
43  ROS_INFO("Target grid coordinates: [%d, %d]",Px,Py);
44 
45  /* Calculate point pertinences from input landscapes */
46  double P[4];
47  for(int dir=0;dir<4;dir++)
48  {
49  P[dir] = pow(matrices[Px+RES*Py+RES*RES*dir].data,GAMMA);
50  ROS_INFO("P[%d]=%f",dir,P[dir]);
51  }
52 
53  /* Perform mapping of all landscapes into one */
54  // i = columns, j = rows
55  for(int i=0;i<RES;i++)
56  {
57  for(int j=0;j<RES;j++)
58  {
59  landscape[i+RES*j].data =
60  (P[0]*matrices[i+RES*j].data +
61  P[1]*matrices[i+RES*j+1*RES*RES].data +
62  P[2]*matrices[i+RES*j+2*RES*RES].data +
63  P[3]*matrices[i+RES*j+3*RES*RES].data)
64  *matrices[i+RES*j+(NZ-1)*RES*RES].data;
65  if(landscape[i+RES*j].data>max)
66  max = landscape[i+RES*j].data;
67  }
68  }
69  /* Attach obtained matrix to response */
70  for(int i=0;i<RES*RES;i++)
71  {
72  landscape[i].data = (landscape[i].data)/max;
73  res.landscape.push_back(landscape[i]);
74  }
75 
76  ROS_INFO("Successfully mapped the pertinences");
77 
78  return true;
79 }
80 
81 /* Main function */
82 int main(int argc, char **argv)
83 {
84  /* Initialize, assign a node handler and advertise service */
85  ros::init(argc, argv, "pertinence_mapping_server");
86  ros::NodeHandle n;
87  ros::ServiceServer service =
88  n.advertiseService("pertinence_mapper", PertinenceMapper);
89  ROS_INFO("Pertinence Mapping service active");
90  ros::spin();
91 
92  return 0;
93 }

#define GAMMA
